title: Ticket #4438: Debian 7 build doesn't on stock Debian 7
description: We can't compile the python bindings on a stock Debian 7 installation because Python's pyconfig.h incorrectly defines HAVE_IO_H. Python itself appears to ignore this #define (as does HTCondor), but our Globus external does not, and thus tries to #include <io.h>, which can not succeed. I fixed this in the BaTLab by editing pyconfig.h. That's distinctly suboptimal, and the proposed fix reorders headers to avoid the problem (adding some #undef magic to avoid multiple-definition warnings).
remarks:
2014-Jul-02 16:49:04 by jfrey:
Code Review

I approve this change.

2014-Jul-30 13:29:47 by tlmiller:
None of our users should be trying to build standard universe on Debian 7, so we won't clutter up the version history with this.
